name: Reasonable doubt
description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

key_work.creator_credit: Ryan White, Jessica Hargrave, Greenwich Entertainment and Tripod Media
key_work.brief_description: In the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, editing factual media has the ability to create doubt, shedding new light on closed cases and can even right the wrongs of the justice system.

end.brief_description: Errol Morris’s unique documentary dramatically re-enacts the crime scene and investigation of a police officer’s murder in Dallas in a film that the Criterion Collection describes as “a work of meticulous journalism and gripping drama”.

constellations_other.name: Reconstructing reality
constellations_other.description: While documentary pertains to be about the truth, many filmmakers and artists have used ingenious reconstructions to represent an abstracted honesty.

links.description: I’ll Be Gone in the Dark uses highly stylised images of creeping shadows to create a haunting atmosphere. 32 year earlier, The Thin Blue Line revolutionised documentary film by incorporating highly stylised re-enactments, controversially blurring the line between fact and fiction.
